summary.body: Does anyone know if there are there any mother and baby support groups based in the barbican?
summary.subject: Mother & Baby

summary.body: I just discovered today that the Barbican cinema has started a baby & parent screening. Mondays at 12am, for children under 1 year.  Here's the link
summary.subject: Parent & baby cinema!

summary.body: Hello, I wanted to see if any other parents are missing not being able to take their kids to the pool at the weekend.  I have complained to the management a couple of times about reinstating a lifeguard, but they say the problem is they're not able to find a lifeguard that will only work for a couple of hours a day. I think if there's enough of us that rally around and push for it, Virgin will make more of an effort to find somebody/have to increase the wage to make it more of an attractive offer.   I know we're able to use the faciltiies at the Islington site but with all the baggage, inflatables etc. it's just another hike I want to avoid at the weekend - in the time we save we might even be able to squeeze in the luxury of a few Sunday papers. Oh the crazy, glamorous life we parents lead! Here's hoping! Best, Sam
summary.subject: No Lifeguard for Children at Virgin Barbican Pool

summary.body: Hello everyone! Does anyone know of baby or expectant parents clubs (formal or informal) here in the Barbican? We are expecting our first child at the end of March. I know there are a lot of new parents here as we see them in the gardens - it would be great to get to know some of them - anyone any experience of this? Many thanks in advance for any suggestions.
summary.subject: Baby/Expectant Parents Clubs

summary.body: Drug, Alcohol and Internet Safety Event  City of London Drug Action Team With parenting, family and social issues such us drug awareness and internet safety at the front of our minds more and more, the Drug Action Team will be hosting two events for parents to attend - offering practical, useful advice on the issues that really matter, please come along and share your concerns with people who care & understand. 1st event Golden Lane Community Centre (Opposite Great Arthur House - Tower Block) Golden Lane Date and time: Tuesday 9th October at 6.30 pm 2nd event Middlesex Street Community Hall Middlesex Street Estate Date and time: Tuesday 17th October at 6.30 pm Both events will feature discussions & questions and will be friendly and informal
summary.subject: Drug / Alcohol and Internet Safety event
